channel.title: mbAInewsletter
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from mbAInewsletter, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘American Idol’ music supervisor and husband found dead at LA home, apparent victims of burglary gone wrong
item.description: An “American Idol” spokesperson confirmed the deaths of Robin Kaye and her husband, Thomas Deluca, both 70.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says ‘doing our best’ to serve China after meeting Beijing officials
item.description: "They want to know that Nvidia continues to invest here, that we are still doing our best to serve the market here," he said.

item.title: Home sellers are so fed up with cutting listing prices they’re just yanking their homes off the market altogether
item.description: Delistings jumped 47% year-over-year in June, according to Realtor.com.

item.title: Forget quiet quitting—millennials are taking ‘quiet vacations’ and checking out of work (and the country) on company dime instead
